column4: should I worry about virus when using ubuntu? what do you advice?
no and ther's clam and clamgtk
don't install any strange package
what do you mean strange?
things that aren't in the repos or you don't know the source is safe
ok man..I got it
say like getdeb.net, that's pretty ok ;)
if you're paranoid check things out every once in a while with netstat -ntl  or namap to see any strange network thing running
ok guy..hey...o you know about java configuration at ubuntu?
for developing, sudo aptitude install sun-java6-jdk , for regular use, sudo aptitude install sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin
the problem is that when I use  "java -version" i get java 1.6, but i want to use java 1.5
I changed the path already..but it didn't work
that's sun-java5-jre
install that, then sudo update-alternatives --config java
or check out galternative/galternatives ,whichever is the correct spelling
I'll think more about..maybe i don't need to go back to java 1.5
either one ought to let you choose the config java that's running
alternatives? how?
install that, then sudo update-alternatives --config java <<
or check out galternative/galternatives ,whichever is the correct spelling
very cool...it worked :)
np
thanks man
I discovered this irc channel today..i'll get back here more times :)
